New Records: The victory against the Raptors marked head coach Tom Thibodeau's 200th win for the franchise, becoming the fifth coach in its history to reach this mark.
Key Match Events: The New York Knicks convincingly beat the Toronto Raptors 112-98.
Karl Anthony-Towns tallied 27 points and 13 rebounds.
The Knicks snapped a three-game losing streak with this victory.
Post-Match Reflections: In the post-game press conference, Tom Thibodeau expressed his satisfaction at his players' hustle, a huge improvement upon their 'low-energy' defeat to Orlando on Monday Night.
Tom Thibodeau complimented his players' mental fortitude and seemed to have an optimistic outlook for the season ahead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A brutal fight broke out in the bleachers between two fans during the game.
The Raptors now have the second fewest wins in the NBA and remain prime contenders to land premium lottery picks Cooper Flagg and Ace Bailey in the 2025 NBA Draft.
